page.title: 01THE WANSFORD AREA
page.content: The Wansford area is dominated by farmland, open pasture land and the two villages of Wansford and Yarwell. Wansford is the largest village out of the two, and extends along the River Nene. To the west of Wansford there is Cocker Wood, surrounded by fields. Several of these are bordered by quarries, some which are old and no longer mined. South-west of Wansford there is Old Sulehay Forest and the adjoining Cows Wood. Further south is more woodland, known as John's Wood and Ring Haw. An opencast mining area lies far south of John's Wood, and bordering these woods is the straight Roman Road. There are more Roman remains, of a building, north of the road on the other side of Cocker Wood.
